aboutPage.title: About TraceIt
aboutPage.missionText: TraceIt's mission is to provide a seamless and efficient platform for managing lost and found items within the campus community. We leverage technology to reconnect students and staff with their valuable belongings, fostering a more connected and supportive environment.
aboutPage.step1Text: Found something? Report it in seconds. Lost something? Post a request and let the community help you out.
aboutPage.step2Text: Our AI-powered system analyzes descriptions, categories, locations, and photos to help you find potential matches quickly — even across English and Hindi.
aboutPage.step3Text: Once a match is found, you can chat securely to verify ownership and arrange the handover.
aboutPage.featureAIText: We use an offline multilingual transformer so descriptions in English and Hindi can match accurately (e.g., “wallet” ↔ “बटुआ”).
aboutPage.featureChatText: Claim an item, the reporter approves chat, and both parties verify details before meeting to retrieve the item.
aboutPage.featureRewardsText: Successful returns automatically award Service Points (e.g., +100 per retrieval) unlocking campus rewards.
aboutPage.featureRealtimeText: You’ll see new messages instantly and claim status changes reflected across Matches and My Queries.
aboutPage.flow1Text: The requester claims a found item from the Matches page.
aboutPage.flow2Text: The reporter reviews and accepts/rejects the chat request.
aboutPage.flow3Text: Both users verify details (photo, description, unique marks) in chat.
aboutPage.flow4Text: Reporter marks the claim resolved after handover; claimer confirms retrieval.
aboutPage.flow5Text: The system awards Service Points and removes the retrieved item from active feeds and Matches.
aboutPage.techText: TraceIt runs bilingual text matching locally using Xenova’s multilingual transformer (no external calls for embeddings). Images are stored securely, and chat/notifications run over sockets. We use MongoDB with vector search where available, with a local cosine fallback to stay resilient.
aboutPage.creatorText: TraceIt was built to make campus life better through practical innovation. It is maintained with care and continuously improved based on real user feedback. The project was created by Sudhanwa, Aditya Jha, and Pawan Meena — students passionate about building useful campus tools.

items.q: How does the AI matching work?
items.a: Our system converts your item details (title, description, location, category, photo) into special numeric codes called embeddings. It compares them across all items in the database to find the most semantically similar matches, not just keyword matches. English and Hindi descriptions are supported equally.

Yes. Only your name, department, and item details are shared during claims. Contact details are never exposed publicly. Chat and embeddings run securely, and all sensitive data is stored with protection.

items.q: What happens after I claim an item?
items.a: When you claim a matched item, the reporter is notified. If they approve, a secure chat opens where you can verify ownership (for example, through unique marks). After successful handover, the reporter marks the item as resolved and you confirm retrieval. The item then disappears from the Matches section.

items.q: How do I earn service points?
items.a: When a reporter successfully returns a found item and the claimer confirms retrieval, the reporter automatically earns +100 Service Points. These points represent your helpfulness in the campus community.

items.q: What if I don’t see any matches?
items.a: Try adding a clearer title, more detailed description, or uploading a photo. You can also refresh Matches manually using the 'Search matches now' button. New reports are continuously processed by the AI.

items.q: What if my chat request is rejected?
items.a: If your chat request is rejected, it means the reporter believes the item doesn’t match your description. You can still claim or chat for other similar items.

items.q: Where should we meet for item handover?
items.a: For safety, always meet in public campus areas like the library front desk or admin office. Verify ownership politely before handing over the item.

helpPage.title: Help Center
helpPage.a1: Click the 'Register' button on the navbar and fill in your college details. You will need a valid college email and roll number to sign up.
helpPage.q2: How do I report an item I found?
helpPage.a2: Navigate to the 'Report Item' page from the navbar. Fill in all details accurately—especially category, sub-category, location and a clear description. Upload a clear photo to improve matching and retrieval chances.
helpPage.tipsPhoto: Upload at least one clear photo showing unique marks
helpPage.tipsTitle: Use a precise title, e.g., “Black Leather Wallet”
helpPage.tipsLocation: Add where you found it and where it is now
helpPage.qRequest: How do I request a lost item?
helpPage.aRequest: Open 'Request Item', describe what you lost, and submit. You’ll be taken to the Matches page where our AI suggests likely found items.
helpPage.tipBilingual: Bilingual matching: English/Hindi descriptions are matched using an offline multilingual model (e.g., “wallet” ↔ “बटुआ”).
helpPage.aRefresh: Use the 'Search matches now' button to re-run AI matching. New reports appear as they are posted. Retrieved items are automatically removed from matches.
helpPage.q3: How do I claim an item?
helpPage.a3: On the Matches page, click 'Request to Chat & Claim' on an item you believe is yours. The reporter receives a chat request and can approve or reject it.
helpPage.q4: Where can I manage my claims?
helpPage.a4: Use the 'My Queries' page. It shows claims others made on your items and claims you made on others' items, with current status and next actions.
helpPage.statusPending: Reporter needs to approve your chat request.
helpPage.statusChat: Both parties can exchange messages instantly.
helpPage.statusResolved: Reporter marked as returned; claimer must confirm retrieval.
helpPage.statusConfirmed: Process complete. Points awarded to reporter.
helpPage.statusRejected: Request was declined; you can claim a different item.
helpPage.q5: What is the full claim flow?
helpPage.flow1: Requester clicks Claim on a matched found item.
helpPage.flow2: Reporter approves chat; both verify ownership (unique marks, photos, etc.).
helpPage.flow3: They meet to hand over the item safely (ideally in a public campus spot).
helpPage.flow4: Reporter marks the claim as resolved; requester confirms retrieval.
helpPage.flow5: Reporter receives +100 Service Points; item disappears from active feeds and Matches.
helpPage.aRewards: When a found item is successfully returned and confirmed, the reporter is awarded Service Points automatically. Track your progress on the Rewards page.
helpPage.fix1: Re-check your title, sub-category and description for clarity.
helpPage.fix2: Add a photo if possible; it helps reporters recognise your item.
helpPage.fix3: Click “Search matches now” to refresh—new posts appear frequently.
helpPage.aChatDelay: Check your internet connection. Chat runs in real-time via sockets; if idle, the client may reconnect when you next interact.
helpPage.aPrivacy: Text matching runs locally using an offline multilingual model; photos and chat are stored securely. Only essential details are shared during the claim/chat process.
helpPage.tipMeet: For handovers, meet in public campus areas (e.g., library front desk) and verify identity politely.
